content:
So I'm looking at my list of things to do and I'm seeing quite a bit that's not so much as a learning curve but a learning cliff. Might as well sound out of any of you are willing to work for money. There's a caveat: the website this is building is also our business model, meaning that payment is going to have to be on some kind of deferred model to startâ€”but afterwards, switch to normal. (I'm an IT guy. I'm not asking for pro bono work unless someone here really grooves on our science educational mission, and I fully intend to treat you and your bank account with respect.)

What I think is needed:

  • Support work taking over programming that's just beyond me and not likely to be graspable in the short term
  • Handholding for a walkthrough for such things I can do with a little assistance the first time
  • The wisdom to know the difference
  • Overall redo of the design and maybe UI; right now, the site is heavily Basis and text-only
  • Eventually, part of our student leadership initiative will involve handing this off to students for at least maintenance and some programming; this might need training or more assistance.

In other words, it's a long-term thing, and obviously people willing to do some work under less-than-optimal payment arrangements will be first in line for when we have a normal business arrangement. Bonus if you have CiviCRM or OpenSocial experience, as I'm assuming right now I'll need different people there.

Any takers? Please email me at jeff@spusa.org so I don't miss a message here.
Hi @Jeff Porten I sent you an email.
I would say I "really grooves on our science educational mission": started life as a highschool physics teacher. :slight_smile: Glad @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) can help.
@docwilmot if you want to help out, I'm happy to stay out of your way. :slight_smile:
Oh no, please, I am unreliable timewise, and inexperienced in anything but writing code. Jeff sounds like he needs much more than I could offer. Happy to help if needed tho.

@docwilmot Would you mind sending me an email at jeff@spusa.org so I can more easily remind myself that you grooves on our mission? :-) I fear information I read here may be labelled "ephemeral" in my head.
